Title: Prohibits utility companies from imposing certain additional fees to customers at their primary residence who are over sixty-five years of age or who have a developmental disability
Summary: Prohibits electric, gas, telephone, cellular telephone, television, internet, energy, water services or any other utility providers from imposing additional fees related to administrative surcharges, fees for non-use or any other charges to customers living at their primary residence who are over sixty-five years of age or who have a developmental disability.
LawCode: Amd §§65, 91, 224-b & 89-b, Pub Serv L; amd §399-zzzz, Gen Bus L
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the public service law and the general business law, in relation to prohibiting utility companies from imposing certain additional fees to customers at their primary residence who are over sixty-five years of age or who have a developmental disability
